page.title: 10NEWHEY PLAYGROUP
page.content: Newhey playgroup meets in a portacabin which was bought in 1984 with the aid of a Government grant.The group previously met in Ellenroad Ring Mill which has since been demolished. The playgroup sessions run from 9.15 to 11.45 and the cost is Â£2.75 per child per week. The group can cater for upto 30 children of pre-school age. There is a Committee of twelve mothers who run the group. The money raised through charges is used to pay ground rent,insurance and fuel bills. Fund raising events are necessary. Normally five adults teach the children; the group leader is Aunty Cath and she is helped by an assistant and three volunteers. The children are taught numbers and colours and how to use different equipment and materials. Before the children go home they are read a story and sing songs.
